story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Serenissima Gravel land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Serenissima Gravel? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Serenissima Gravel scored 47 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Serenissima Gravel. Venice, Italy. 65 mi. Italian flat to rolling gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Fourteen dimensions. Here's where it lands. Logistics. 3 out of 5. Gets the job done. Nothing fancy. The race delivers on operational execution despite changing course layout between editions - moving from Jesolo to Porto Barricata to Cittadella over four years. Length. 3 out of 5. The Goldilocks zone of suffering. Lutsenko's winning solo attack came with 80km remaining, sustaining "3. Climate. 3 out of 5. Variable. Bring layers and a flexible attitude. Mid-October in the Veneto region typically delivers stable gravel conditions before winter sets in. Adventure. 3 out of 5. This race takes you somewhere different. The race traverses through Treviso "a city of 100,000 inhabitants" entirely on gravel roads, showcasing ancient Veneto charm around the 16th-century Villa Contarini. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. The stripped-down racing format eliminates team cars and radios, forcing self-reliance that Lutsenko described as "a feeling that I hadn't felt in a long time. Community. 3 out of 5. Good vibes. Riders actually talk to each other. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. The pro-only format with WorldTour participation creates distinctive racing unavailable elsewhere in gravel. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Some chunky bits. Nothing catastrophic. Lutsenko described "very narrow roads and so many corners" on the technical parcours, with 83% gravel surfaces including single-track through the Po Delta.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The remaining six. Quick-fire. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Modest field. Some fast riders in the mix. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Your wallet will remember this. Briefly. Elevation. 1 out of 5. Flat. Your climbing legs get a rest day. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: Where Serenissima Gravel earns its score.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: The logistics. What you actually need to know.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Venice area has good lodging options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Venice Area Flat Gravel. If you're in Italy/Europe. yes, it's solid. If you're international. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Serenissima Gravel isn't quite right for you. For similar Italian events: Veneto Gravel. For more elevation: Italian mountain races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Serenissima Gravel? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Serenissima Gravel' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
